FuncDef:
The configuration re-authentication enable command enables secondary authentication for the execution of risky commands.
The undo configuration re-authentication enable command disables secondary authentication for risky command execution. The configuration re-authentication enable command enables secondary authentication for the execution of risky commands. The undo configuration re-authentication enable command disables secondary authentication for risky command execution. By default, secondary authentication is disabled.
ExtraInfo: Some undo commands on the device will delete related feature configurations if they are incorrectly executed. As a result, services and user networks are interrupted. To prevent misoperations, you need to perform secondary authentication to protect the system when running these undo commands.
